stories.title: Abba's Bjorn Ulvaeus launches campaign to fix £500m music royalty problem

stories.text: Let's say CircleCi gets 100,000 companies paying their 30$/month subscription (I think that's a pretty ambitious number, or am I naive?) this puts them at 36 million $ yearly income, even today they have over 600 employees - assuming an average of 180k$/y per employee this puts them paying 108 million $ just on salaries. Which part of the story am I missing? what makes investors believe they are going to see big returns?
stories.title: Will CircleCI make big $s?

stories.text:
The elevator in my condo building has been acting weird for well over a month now, it randomly won't go to some floors sometimes.

As you can imagine this is incredibly annoying and I've complained numerous times to the condo association and the management. The response is always the same, the elevator company are not able to fix it yet, for "reasons" but it will be fixed as soon as they can. After a painful 15 minute wait to get to my floor, I finally called the elevator company and asked them why they're unable to service the elevator in a brand new 46 floor building for over a month.

The answer, the computer manufacturer is unable to get chips, nor do they know when they will, so the computer unit is backordered, indefinitely.

Wondering if anyone else has daily life chip shortage anecdotes?
stories.title: Ask HN: Have you experienced any real word examples of the chip shortage?
The old speak: Wassenaar, Google, and why Spender is right

stories.text:
WebDataRocks finally presents new features with the 1.4 release. This pivot table is created by developers for developers, so it is an excellent choice as a software for data analysis. WebDataRocks pivot table is free and easy to integrate along with other useful features!

The main release improvement – framework wrappers for Vue, React and Angular. Just a few lines of code can elegantly and quickly embed WebDataRocks into your project. No extra time for integration with one of these JavaScript frameworks, just check the guides and here you are.

Along with improvements in the framework area WebDataRocks also cared for pivot customization: they added 3 new predefined themes. Now you can choose the most suitable theme for your design from the 8 offered.

Minor fixes were also done, read more at https://www.webdatarocks.com!
stories.title: New WebDataRocks pivot table release 2021

stories.text:
I'm curious as to what do you think about the following situation, so I'll present it as a timeline:

2016: I buy my first iPhone. Amazing piece of tech, does everything I want it to do. It just works.

2019: I buy a AirPods. They integrate amazingly with the phone. They just work.

2020: I want to release an iOS app, so I buy a Macbook Air (Intel, irrelevant). I like it (slim, long battery life, does what I need it to do, albeit somehow slow).

2020: I want to do more stuff on the Mac, including audio / video calls. I buy a pair of jack earpods.

Now, I can't use the AirPods all day because the battery just doesn't handle it, understandably. I turn to the earpods. Decent sound, terrible microphone quality. These become a necessity as my app (and therefore business) grow bigger and bigger. One year later in 2021 I'm using the Mac camera and jack earpods, and I constantly get complaints either on video or audio quality from my microphone.

As a genuine question, how does Apple want me to deal with this situation? I paid somewhere around $2200 for this tech, should I not expect it to just work and do what it should do? How do you deal with this?
stories.title: Ask HN: [Apple] From a business perspective, what's expected of me in this case?
